portfolio.title: Genesis
portfolio.about:
This is the first game I ever worked on.

It is a very personal project that is heavily inspired by Earthbound. It was a fun retelling of adventures with my friends mixed with the world I have written for a long time.

Genesis’ soundtrack was composed by FloorBaba & RickyBrugal with the addition of Fluidvolt, Shannon Mason, TobyFox, and many others wonderful composers from the Earthbound: I Miss You album. The game wasn't completed, but I have hopes that one day I will be able to finish this love letter to coming of age.

portfolio.title: Ruby Version
portfolio.about: This project is the first time I ever picked up a Gameboy and started composing my own music. This mixtape was mainly me learning my way around LSDJ and my gateway to chiptune composition. The constriction of only 4 sound channels and 4 buttons with a D-Pad to write music allowed me to experiment with audio in ways I have never known to be possible before.

portfolio.title: Results of My:
portfolio.text: A collection of recordings experessing the effects on myself, others and the environment.
portfolio.about: ROM is me taking what I learned from my first mixtape attempting to express my feelings through my music. This mixtape is a collection of emotions during my last year of high school.

portfolio.title: Paracentric
portfolio.text: A surreal horror RPG made in 24 hours.
portfolio.about:
Vexing, Censorship, Weird were the 3 words my team and I received as a prompt for Becker College’s 24 Hour Game Jam.

Paracentric went on to win 2nd place in the game jam and a 4-star rating and over 600 downloads on game jolt.

I’m most proud of is the fact that the game has a Video Game Tropes page.

portfolio.title: MW Classic
portfolio.text: Prototype abstract platforming at it's finest.
portfolio.about:
MW is the mechanic. Platforming is the idea. MW was originally made for Becker College IDGA’s Minimalistic Game Jam. Unfortunately, the game jam was canceled, but the game was finished.

Releasing MW is problematic since the engine I worked in is no longer supported no longer export MW, thus it sits in limbo.

It’s currently being redeveloped on to be released in a better engine in HD in 2017.

portfolio.title: ChexMix LP
portfolio.text: An experimental compilation of experience, influence, and inspiration.
portfolio.about:
This mixtape was a test of my skills as a chiptune musician. I combined songs into each other and mixed over them midway through a song using the power of the 4-bit audio processor of the Nintendo Gameboy.

With over 40 minutes of sounds, I challenged myself to make some songs with only one channel or dipped into genre’s I’ve never composed before.

portfolio.title: RocMoto
portfolio.about:
My love of Japanese Shoot-em-Ups, F-Zero, and Wip3out inspired the aggressive high-speed shooter RocMoto. RocMoto’s main mechanic is using the ship to crash into enemies as a way of gaining energy. Originally I started this to teach myself a new game engine but turned the project into a full fledge production.

With this project, I taught myself how to create better experiences and how to incite a feeling in users with little details. I halted the production RocMoto to work on smaller projects as a means of learning more in the time I had at school.

I’m hoping to return to this project and start from scratch in a better engine.

portfolio.title: F Mode
portfolio.about:
F Mode is a 3-hour game jam prototype that turned out to be an overnight success. I took that 3-hour prototype and rereleased a graphically updated version for Android in one week.

F Mode is an abstract breakneck endless runner that was a test of my abilities and inspired me to focus on primarily designing mobile games.
blurb:
Unlike alot of endless runners that focus on a solitary gameplay gimmick F Mode throws a whole slew of different potential “game over”s at once. Add in a really neat versus mode that lets friends see who can last the longest without getting gobbled up by digital aquatic life out on a cyber rampage and you’ve got yourself a winner.

-Craig Forshey Super Game Droid

portfolio.title: Some Place, Some Where
portfolio.text: An experiment with looping game soundtracks.
portfolio.about: This mixtape was written in the middle of the woods aka nowhere during my 2013 Winter break from school. Originally this soundtrack was going to be the looping music used in RocMoto, instead, I choose to release the mixtape as a standalone testament to my will in a very dark place.

portfolio.title: Starlot Derby
portfolio.text: The slickest intergalactic baseball game this side of the universe.
portfolio.about:
As a means of making baseball games great again, I tasked myself with solely developing a baseball game you couldn’t play outside. After a long 6 months, Starlot Derby has been met with praise from industry professionals and baseball fans alike.

As Craig Forshey of Super Game Droid states, “...there is nothing that even comes close to delivering the sheer zaniness of indie developer Maximum Crash’s psychedelic new arcade batting game Starlot Derby.”

Halfway through the games development I entered the Mass DiGI Game Challenge (2015) and won the Beta/Near Complete College Beta Entertainment category.

This game went on to snag a deal with a local baseball team in Worcester,MA and currently has a sequel in the works.

portfolio.title: Reiner.io
portfolio.about: A good friend of mine commissioned me with making a logo representing him. I took the technical qualities of him and developed the I/O logo that forms the first letter of his name.

portfolio.title: Hibachi Hero
portfolio.text: A fast-paced first person food shooter.
portfolio.about:
Hibachi Hero was a game I worked on as part of a team in Mass DiGI’s Summer Innovation Program. For 11 weeks, my colleagues and I worked endlessly to bring the tastiest food shooter on the app store.

As the lead designer, I helped to solidify our mechanics and themes, as well as help to keep our game within the scope of 11 weeks.

I also developed tools that helped speed up asset production and allowed our artists to interact with the game without writing a single line of code.

Our hard work paid off when at the end of the program our game was not only acquired by mobile publisher Thumbspire but when we were notified our game had also been a huge success with helping kids with behavioral disorders.

During the program, we were tasked with developing a version that helped kids control their behaviors for Neuromotion as a means providing a replacement for drugs.

portfolio.title: Bravehearts Derby
portfolio.about:
Bravehearts Derby is the collective efforts of Maximum Crash, Mass DiGI, and The Worcester Bravehearts. The app is a means of giving the Worcester Bravehearts a digital platform to reach their fan base and to expand their brand globally, even when offseason.

With over 400 downloads and the app being played in 7 different countries, I could say Bravehearts Derby is a…homerun!

portfolio.title: Woo Game Pile
portfolio.about:
I joined the Worcester Game Pile in January of 2015. So far it’s been a wild ride of supporting the community of developers in Worcester Massachusetts. In June we decided to rebrand our collective.

I was tasked with developing just a new logo, but I took it further. I redesigned the visual branding of the collective and established design rulesets for Game Pile. This included the website, logo, fliers, banners, etc.

I’m honored to have the opportunity to work with such wonderful people and help to establish a waypoint for developers in Central Mass.

portfolio.title: The Boston Massacre
portfolio.text: Proving critical learning through interaction with historical data.
portfolio.about:
As a Digital Media Specialist at Victory Productions, I had the task of designing and developing a classroom lesson on The Boston Massacre.

The twist is that we wanted to let students interact with data to prove critical learning by allowing the student to interact and come up with their own conclusions to how the event could have been avoided.

With the leadership of directors who had previously worked for Scholastic, WGBH, and more, I have been able to develop a web application that is both educating for both the user and myself.

abouthtml:
I'm a Full-Stack Designer and Developer who loves to experiment with interactive experiences.

I've been digitally solving problems for 4 years, while attending Becker College in Worcester, Massachusettes.

I've done design and development for:

  • Web Apps

  • Mobile Apps

  • Games

  • Desktop Apps

  • E-Learning

I run a digital production studio -> Maximum Crash

I'm also a board member of the Worcester Game Pile

In my spare time I teach game development to kids at the Worcester Public Library and like to draw cartoons, skateboard, travel, make chiptune music (I use a gameboy), and take care of my plant (promptly named “dude”).
